pullRequest.title: Focus widget
pullRequest.bodyText:
Motivation and Context
The user wants to set a single widget in focus by removing all other widgets temporarily and see the focused widget in full screen.
Description

Add a new CurrentViewState[Store/Actions] which will store the widget in focus
Render the focused widget instead of the WidgetGrid
Unset focused Widget before going into big display mode
Adjust css styling

Screenshots (if appropriate):

Types of changes

 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Refactoring (non-breaking change)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)

nodes.bodyText: Do we need to put this in the CurrentViewStateStore? I would suggest creating a separate context for this instead, which provides the current state and the actions to modify it.

beforeCommit.message: Reset focus on certain Field Actions

afterCommit.message: Remove CurrentViewStateActions.focusWidget and use WidgetFocusContext instead

beforeCommit.message: only render focused widget if it is still in the widgets list

nodes.bodyText: We need to use  const { focusedWidget } = useContext(WidgetFocusContext); here as well, right now focusedWidget  is always true.

We could also provide a default value of { focusedWidget: undefined, setFocusedWidget: () => {} } here. This would also make it unnecessary to provide a context provider for all tests, even the unrelated ones. If we want to make sure that a provider is always in place, we could throw an error from setFocusedWidget.

nodes.bodyText: Can we move all of the props which are constantly reused to the SUT definition? This way we can separate the boilerplate and override in tests what's actually different, which makes it way easier to understand.

I think we should move this to a separate function itself (renderFocussedWidget?) and do a conditional in the Query function, e.g. return focussedWidget ? renderFocussedWidget(...) : renderWidgetGrid(...); - this makes it easy to understand.

commit.message: Move widget creation to a component for reusability
Use icon instead of menu entry point to focus
Fix world map size calculation problem
Fix layout for dashboards which needs an additional row
Unset focus before going into big display mode
Adjust grid lay out based on viewType
Reset focus on certain Field Actions
Remove CurrentViewStateActions.focusWidget and use WidgetFocusContext instead
only render focused widget if it is still in the widgets list
Hide unneeded icon buttons of widget if focused mode

Fix problem with bad setState call.

## Motivation
Prior to this change, we got under certain situtations following:
```
Warning: Cannot update a component (`WidgetFocusProvider`) while
rendering a different component (`Query`). To locate the bad setState()
call inside `Query`, follow the stack trace as described in
https://fb.me/setstate-in-render
    in Query (created by ConnectStoresWrapper[Query] stores=widgets)
    in ConnectStoresWrapper[Query] stores=widgets
    in div (created by Col)
    in Col (created by SearchResult__StyledCol)
    in SearchResult__StyledCol
    in div (created by Row)
    in Row (created by SearchResult__StyledRow)
    in SearchResult__StyledRow
```

## Description
This change will remove the line which causes the problem.
It was meant as a safty net, but not really needed.
Transfer code to render widget in its own function
